newsitem.title: USA: NYCE cotton settles up, drifts in recent range.
newsitem.headline: NYCE cotton settles up, drifts in recent range.

text.p: NYCE cotton futures closed firmer but drifted away from the day's highs near the close, signaling possible weakness early next week, market sources said.
The most-active December contract remained within its recent trading range of 74.00 to 72.00, and proved unable to hold above key resistance pegged at 73.00.
Analysts see prices eventually falling below the December contract's low of 70.50.
The contract ended up 0.34 at 72.54, having ranged from 73.20 to 72.10. The deferred months closed 0.70 to 0.12 firmer.
A dearth of news has contributed to the market's dull tone, as weekend weather in most regions is expected to remain mild as the last of the crop is harvest.
The U.S. Department of Agriculture's next crop report will be released November 12. Analysts expect prices to weaken ahead of the data.
